snippet: Several players said they missed aspects of the old gladiator-style training camps because modern restrictions prevented them from honing their blocking and tackling techniques.
abstract: New York Giants training camps are among many in NFL that have cut rough tactics in preseason practices, to prevent injuries; 2011 NFL labor agreement did away with common practice of punishing two-a-day practice regimen, but some New York Giants players say sessions feel more like aggressive touch football games, and worry they will not be fully prepared for real NFL season play.
lead_paragraph: Several players said they missed aspects of the old gladiator-style training camps because modern restrictions prevented them from honing their blocking and tackling techniques.

headline.main: Giants Can’t Give Big Hits for Now, and That Hurts, Some Players Say
headline.print_headline: Restrictions on Hard Hits Are a Cause for Concern for Some Giants Players
